intro: Anthemis gillettii, commonly known as Gillett's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow-orange flower heads composed of numerous small florets, which are typical of the genus Anthemis. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
